snippet: I remember her urging her neighbour Sir Thomas Lauder, not long before her death, to dine with her next Sunday u For Eh ! Sir Thammas ! we re terrible near the tail noo." She told me that her oldest friends were the Inneses of Stow and the Scotts of Malleny families she had known for above eighty -five years. They and the Mortonhall family had each a mansion house in town ; two of them being the two corner houses at the lower end of a close leading from the High Street down to the Cowgate, and the third one of the corner houses opposite, at the lower end of the close leading from the Cowgate southwards , each of the three houses looking into both the Cowgate and the close. title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: The road now skirts the rocky eminences called the Hills of Braid, which command  a beautiful view of Edinburgh, with the Frith of Forth, and the shores of Fife in the background. The more northern side, called Blackford Hill, the property of Richard Trotter, Esq. of Mortonhall, is the spot mentioned in " Marmion."
